results.title: At Veterans Hospital in Oregon, a Push for Better Ratings Puts Patients at Risk, Doctors Say
results.abstract: At Roseburg Veterans Affairs Medical Center, doctors and nurses said, hospital administrators reject high-risk patients in pursuit of a higher score.

multimedia.caption: Walter Savage, 81, an Air Force veteran, at a medical center in Roseburg, Ore. Mr. Savage was turned away from the veterans hospital there even though two doctors said he should have been admitted.

results.title: Recreational Pot Is Officially Legal in California
results.abstract: Amid a slow and halting rollout, marijuana shops opened Monday in Oakland and a handful of other cities.

results.title: The Hunt for ‘Fire Cats’ Amid Northern California Ashes
results.abstract: In a neighborhood razed by fire, a woman is tracking and trapping house cats that fled in October and still elude their owners.
org_facet: Humane Society of the United States

multimedia.caption: Jennifer Petruska, left, and Barbara Gray set a trap in Santa Rosa, Calif. Ms. Petruska is coordinating an effort to find cats lost during the wildfire.

results.title: Colorado Gunman Shoots 5 Officers Near Denver, One Fatally
results.abstract: The sheriff of Douglas County in Colorado described the deputy who was killed, Zackari Parrish, as a “smiley kid” who was eager to serve.
results.byline: By CHRISTOPHER MELE and JACK HEALY

results.title: Fatal ‘Swatting’ Episode in Kansas Raises Quandary: Who Is to Blame?
results.abstract: A fake report of a hostage situation led to the death of an innocent man at the hands of the police. Who bears responsibility?

results.title: Glitch in South Carolina Lottery Could Mean $19.6 Million in Winnings
results.abstract: A computer error caused a lottery game to produce too many winning tickets and now the state has set aside nearly $20 million in payouts as it decides what to do.

multimedia.caption: A Powerball slip in Columbia, S.C., in 2013. This Christmas, many customers who played a seasonal game called Holiday Cash Add-a-Play got winning tickets because of a computer glitch.

results.title: The Trump Effect: Business, Anticipating Less Regulation, Loosens Purse Strings
results.abstract: The administration’s campaign to reduce regulation has improved the mood of business executives. They may be spending more money as a result.
results.byline: By BINYAMIN APPELBAUM and JIM TANKERSLEY

multimedia.caption: President Trump said last month at a news conference that he had rolled back 22 regulations for every new one.
President Trump said last month at a news conference that he had rolled back 22 regulations for every new one.

results.title: Korean War, a ‘Forgotten’ Conflict That Shaped the Modern World
results.abstract: The three-year conflict set the stage for decades of tension on the Korean Peninsula, but today many Americans know little about it.

results.title: Pulled Over in a Rental Car, With Heroin in the Trunk
results.abstract: The Supreme Court will hear arguments next week about whether drivers not listed in rental car agreements give up their privacy rights.

multimedia.caption: The Supreme Court is set to decide what happens when a car rental company’s boilerplate contract collides with the Fourth Amendment, which bars unreasonable searches.

results.title: For Trump, a Glittering Gala Ends a Winter Vacation Rooted in Routine
results.abstract: On New Year’s Eve, Mar-a-Lago hosted its annual gala, an opulent but customary occasion for a president who spent his winter vacation reveling in the comforts of familiarity.
results.byline: By EMILY COCHRANE and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

multimedia.caption: President Trump arriving with the first lady, Melania, and their son, Barron, 11, at a New Year’s Eve gala at Mr. Trump’s Mar-a-Lago club in Florida on Sunday night.

results.title: New York Family of 5 Among 10 Americans Killed in Costa Rica Plane Crash
results.abstract: The Costa Rican government said the crash occurred in the mountainous area of Punta Islita, a tourist destination about 140 miles west of the capital, San José.

results.title: Courts Must Better Police Themselves on Harassment, Chief Justice Says
results.abstract: In his year-end report on the state of the federal judiciary, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. addressed reports of sexual misconduct by an appeals court judge.

multimedia.caption: Judge Alex Kozinski of the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit retired two weeks ago after 15 women accused him of sexual harassment.
